perturbation.original_text: Metavante shall provide to Customer and Customer shall receive from Metavante, all upon the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement and Amendments, the Services and licenses specified. The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and end on November 30, 2014 (the "Initial Term"). The parties also agree to use their best efforts to perform the Conversion(s) such that the Commencement Date occurs on or before November 5, 2007.
perturbation.changed_text: Metavante shall provide to Customer and Customer shall receive from Metavante, all upon the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement and Amendments, the Services and licenses specified. The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and end on November 30, 2014 (the "Initial Term"). The parties also agree to use their best efforts to perform the Conversion(s) such that the Service Start Date occurs on or before November 5, 2007.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Commencement Date' is replaced with 'Service Start Date', creating confusion.  'Commencement Date' is a defined term, while 'Service Start Date' is not, making it ambiguous if they refer to the same milestone.
perturbation.location: First Section after the introductory paragraph

perturbation.original_text: Customer agrees that it is responsible for ensuring compliance with this Agreement by its Affiliates. Customer agrees to be responsible for the submission of its Affiliates' data to Metavante for processing and for the transmission to Customer's Affiliates of such data processed by and received from Metavante. Customer agrees to pay any and all fees owed under this Agreement for Services rendered to its Affiliates. The term Affiliates also includes other entities that become affiliates of Customer after the date of this Agreement, due to a reorganization or restructuring of Customer's business, which do not cause an increase in the volume of Customer's transactions.
perturbation.changed_text: Customer agrees that it is responsible for ensuring compliance with this Agreement by its Associated Entities. Customer agrees to be responsible for the submission of its Associated Entities' data to Metavante for processing and for the transmission to Customer's Associated Entities of such data processed by and received from Metavante. Customer agrees to pay any and all fees owed under this Agreement for Services rendered to its Associated Entities. The term Affiliates also includes other entities that become affiliates of Customer after the date of this Agreement, due to a reorganization or restructuring of Customer's business, which do not cause an increase in the volume of Customer's transactions.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Affiliates' is replaced with 'Associated Entities' without defining Associated Entities. This creates uncertainty, as it is not clear if 'Associated Entities' has the same meaning and scope as the defined term 'Affiliates'.

perturbation.original_text: Metavante may, at any time, withdraw any of the Services upon providing ninety (90) days' prior written notice to Customer, provided that Metavante is withdrawing the Service(s) from its entire client base. Metavante may also terminate any function or any Services immediately upon any final regulatory, legislative, or judicial determination that providing such function or Services is inconsistent with applicable law or regulation or the rights of any Third Party. If Metavante terminates any Service pursuant to this paragraph, Metavante agrees to assist Customer, without additional charge, in identifying an alternate provider of such terminated Service, and the Customer shall not be assessed a Termination Fee for such terminated service.
perturbation.changed_text: Metavante may, at any time, withdraw any of the Obligations upon providing ninety (90) days' prior written notice to Customer, provided that Metavante is withdrawing the Obligation(s) from its entire client base. Metavante may also terminate any function or any Services immediately upon any final regulatory, legislative, or judicial determination that providing such function or Services is inconsistent with applicable law or regulation or the rights of any Third Party. If Metavante terminates any Service pursuant to this paragraph, Metavante agrees to assist Customer, without additional charge, in identifying an alternate provider of such terminated Service, and the Customer shall not be assessed a Termination Fee for such terminated service.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Services' is replaced with 'Obligations'. It is not clear if the 'Obligations' has the same defined meaning, which causes enforcement and interpretation issues for whether this action constitutes partial termination.
